thread.title: These are Warren Buffett’s 10 biggest deals
thread.title_full: These are Warren Buffett’s 10 biggest deals - MarketWatch

author: By     Tomi Kilgore
title: These are Warren Buffett’s 10 biggest deals
text:
Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway’s buyout of Precision Castparts Corp. would be the biggest in the famed billionaire investor’s storied career by a wide margin, according to Dealogic.
It also shows Buffett’s preference for companies made in America, as his nine of his 10 biggest deals were with companies domiciled in the U.S.
If debt is included, however, the Precision Castparts deal PCP, +19.10% of $35.81 billion would rank second, just behind the $35.94 billion deal to buy Burlington Northern Santa Fe Corp. in November 2009, according to Dealogic.
The following the top deals ranked by deal value, excluding debt, that Buffett’s Berkshire BRK.B, -0.09% has been involved:
